intro: Psychotria rhodocarpa, commonly known as the red-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its dark green leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. While it is not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique foliage and potential ecological roles.
